page.title: 12Bocking Hall
page.content: The centre of the house was built in about 1500 for the monks from {Canterbury}who administered an area stretching from{E. Mersea}to{Hadleigh, in{Suffolk.}Records are in Kent. There have been additions and alterations to the house over the years. There is evidence of an outside staircase leading to what was probably the court room. The present day pond, is thought to have provided carp for the monks' table. In 1534 the house and land was sold to the{Wentworth family for Â£735! The present facade and a second staircase were added in the 18th century. There is a rumour of a tunnel from the Hall to the church but there is no real evidence of this. Five years ago{Mr & Mrs Pickford bought the Hall from the{Tabor}family and they are carefully restoring this beautiful and interesting home.
